record_data.record_plain_text:
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA BEFORE THE FEDERAL ENERGY REGULATORY COMMISSION Inova Energy LLC) Docket No. ER15-___-000 APPLICATION OF INOVA ENERGY LLC FOR MARKET-BASED RATE AUTHORITY, ASSOCIATED WAIVERS, BLANKET APPROVALS, AND CATEGORY 1 SELLER DETERMINATION _______________________________________________________________________________ Inova Energy LLC (“Applicant”), pursuant to Section 205 of the Federal Power Act (“FPA”),1 Rule 205 of the Rules of Practice and Procedure of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (“Commission”),2 and Part 35 of the Commission’s regulations under the FPA,3 hereby requests that the Commission (1) grant blanket approval for market-based rates for Applicant’s wholesale sales of electric energy, capacity, and ancillary services, (2) accept its proposed market-based rate tariff, FERC Electric Tariff, Volume No. 1 (“Tariff”) to be effective November 3, 2020, which is sixty days from the date of filing,4 (3) grant authority to sell ancillary services at marketbased rates under its Tariff, (4) grant such waivers and blanket authorizations as the Commission has granted in the past to other entities with market-based rate authority, and (5) determine that Applicant is a Category 1 Seller in all geographic regions.
1 16 U.S.C. § 824d. 2 18 C.F.R. § 385.205. 2
3 18 C.F.R. Part 35. 4 The Tariff is submitted herewith as Attachment A. I. COMMUNICATIONS All communications regarding this filing should be directed to the following persons: Eric Brunhammer Natara Feller, Esq. President Attorney Inova Energy LLC Feller Law Group 16233 Kenyon Avenue, Suite 210 20TH St. , Suite 1B Lakeville, MN 55044 Brooklyn, NY 11232 (302) 750-3217 (phone) (952) 241-3008 (phone) (952) 302-691-7279 (facsimile) natara@feller.law eric@inova-energy.com II. DESCRIPTION OF APPLICANT AND ITS AFFILIATES Applicant, a Delaware limited liability company, 100% of Inova Energy LLC Holdings' outstanding common equity interests are currently wholly-owned by one individual, Eric Brunhamer. Applicant proposes to act as a power marketer, purchasing electricity and reselling it to wholesale and retail customers. Applicant does not own, operate or control, nor is it affiliated with, any physical electric generation, transmission, or distribution facilities, any natural gas storage, transportation, or distribution facilities, or any other inputs to electric power generation.1
1 See 18 C.F.R. § 35.36(a)(4). 3
Pursuant to section 35.37(a)(2) of the Commission's regulations,7 Applicant provides a table of assets as Attachment B.
An affiliate of Applicant, Clear Energy Solutions LLC, is a power and gas broker/marketer, that is 100% wholly owned by Eric Brunhammer. Clear Energy Solutions LLC, does not own, operate, or control any physical electric generation, transmission, or distribution facilities, any natural gas storage, transportation, or distribution facilities, or any other inputs to electric power generation. III. REQUEST FOR AUTHORIZATION TO SELL ENERGY AND CAPACITY AT MARKET-BASED RATES With this application, Applicant is filing a FERC Electric Tariff Volume No. 1,8 under which it proposes to provide the following services at market-based rates: (1) wholesale sales of energy and capacity; and (2) ancillary services. For the reasons discussed more fully below, Applicant respectfully requests that the Commission accept for filing its FERC Electric Tariff Volume No. 1 and grant the necessary authorizations for it to provide the above-mentioned services at market based rates. In Order No. 697,9 the Commission consolidated the existing four-prong market power analysis (generation market power, transmission market power, other barriers 4 to entry, affiliate abuse/reciprocal dealing) into a two-prong analysis that focuses on horizontal market power (generation) and vertical market power (transmission
order) (order accepting notice of succession to tariff of Discount Energy Group, LLC). 7 See 18 C.F.R. § 35.37(a)(2). 8 See Attachment A. 9 Market-Based Rates for Wholesale Sales of Electric Energy, Capacity and Ancillary Services by Public Utilities, Order No. 697, FERC Stats. Regs. [Reg. Preambles] 31,252 (2007) (“Order 697”); Market-Based Rates for Wholesale Sales of Electric Energy, Capacity and Ancillary Services by Public Utilities, Order No. 697-A, 123 FERC 61,055 (2008) (“Order No. 697-A”).
market power and barriers to entry).2 Affiliate abuse is no longer a separate “prong” of the market-based rate analysis; instead, affiliate restrictions are now codified in the Commission’s regulations and must be satisfied on an ongoing basis as a condition of obtaining and retaining market-based rate authority.3 Therefore, under Order No. 697, the Commission allows energy and capacity sales at market-based rates, provided that the seller and each of its affiliates do not have (or have adequately mitigated) horizontal and vertical market power.4 The Commission has established similar requirements for those seeking to provide ancillary services at market-based rates.5 As shown below, Applicant satisfies each of the Commission’s standards.
2 See Order No. 697 at PP 397-399. See also 18 C.F.R. § 35.37. 3 Order No. 697 at P 23. 4 See id. at PP 13-22. 5 See, e.g., Avista Corp., 87 FERC 61,223, p. 61,882 (1999). Under Order No. 697, parties seeking to sell Regulation Service, Energy Imbalance Service, Spinning Reserves, and 5 A. Horizontal Market Power (Generation) The Commission requires that an applicant proposing to sell power at market based rates show its lack of horizontal market power by demonstrating that it and its relevant affiliates pass the Pivotal Supplier and the Market Share screens (collectively “Indicative Screens”) in the applicable geographic markets and, if the applicant or seller and its relevant affiliates fail either screen, by providing other evidence showing lack or mitigation of horizontal market power.6 If the applicant and its relevant affiliates pass both screens, there is a rebuttable presumption that the applicant or seller does not possess horizontal market power in the relevant geographic market.7 The Commission has also authorized the submission of streamlined applications and the use of simplifying assumptions, where appropriate.7 Because Applicant does not own, operate or control any electric generation facilities, and is not affiliated with any entity that owns, operates or controls any electric generation facilities, Applicant does not have horizontal market power.
6 Order No. 697 at PP 33-44. 7 Id. at P 33. 7 See Order No. 697 at P 337. 6 Supplemental Reserves under Avista must request that authority in a filing with the Commission. Order No. 697 at P 1060.
B. Vertical Market Power (Transmission Market Power and Barriers to Entry) The vertical market power prong of the Commission’s inquiry consists of an analysis of whether the seller and its affiliates have transmission market power and an analysis of whether they can erect other barriers to entry.8 1. Transmission Market Power Neither Applicant nor its affiliates have market power in transmission. Neither Applicant nor its affiliates own, operate, or control any jurisdictional transmission facilities. 2. Barriers to Entry When reviewing a request for market-based rate authorization, the Commission draws a distinction between two categories of inputs to electric power production: (1) natural gas transportation and storage, oil supply and oil transportation; and (2) intrastate natural gas transportation, storage or distribution facilities, sites for 8 Order No. 697 at PP 397 399. 10 Order No. 697 at P 441. 7 generation capacity development, and sources of coal supplies and the transportation of coal supplies, such as barges and rail cars.10 With regard to the first category, the Commission does not require a
description or affirmative statement with regard to an applicant’s affiliation with or ownership of natural gas supply, interstate gas transportation, and oil supply and transportation.9 With regard to the second category, the Commission adopted a rebuttable presumption that sellers cannot erect barriers to entry with regard to the ownership or control of, or affiliation with any entity that owns or controls intrastate natural gas transportation, intrastate natural gas storage or distribution facilities, sites for generation capacity development, and sources of coal transportation supplies.10 Applicant or its affiliates do not own or control intrastate natural gas transportation, storage or distribution facilities. Neither Applicant nor its affiliates own or control any sources of coal supplies or facilities for the transportation of coal supplies. Neither Applicant or its affiliates do not own or control any sites for potential generation 9 Id. at P 442. 10 Id. at PP 441 446. 8 development. Accordingly, Applicant and its affiliates have not erected, possess any ability to, or will erect barriers to entry to new generation in any geographic market. C. Affiliate Abuse Order No. 697 requires that any seller with market-based rate authority must comply with the affiliate power sales restrictions and other affiliate restrictions.21 Neither applicant nor its affiliates are not a franchised public utility with captive customers. Applicant has included in its Tariff a provision requiring compliance with
the Commission’s regulations, including the affiliate restrictions set forth in Section 35.39 of the Commission’s regulations.22 IV. REQUEST FOR MARKET-BASED RATE AUTHORIZATION TO SELL ANCILLARY SERVICES Applicant also respectfully requests authorization to sell the ancillary services the Commission has authorized utilities with market-based rate authority to sell in the markets administered by New York Independent System Operator, Inc.
21 Order No. 697 at P 467. 22 18 C.F.R. § 35.39.
9 In accordance with the Commission’s requirements, Applicant has listed in its Tariff the specific ancillary services it may sell.11 V. WAIVERS, AUTHORIZATIONS, AND REPORTING REQUIREMENTS Applicant respectfully requests that the Commission grant waivers and authorizations consistent with those granted to other power marketers and independent power producers with market-based rate authority. In particular, Applicant requests:
• Waiver of Subparts B and C of Part 35 of the Commission’s regulations requiring the filing of cost-of-service information, except as to sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15, and 35.16; • Waiver of Parts 41, 101, and 141 of the Commission’s accounting and periodic reporting regulations, except for sections 141.14 and 141.15;12 • Blanket authorization for all future issuances of securities or assumptions of liabilities pursuant to Section 204 of the Federal Power Act, 16 U.S.C. § 824e, and Part 34 of the Commission's Regulations;13 and 11 Order No. 697, Appendix C. Applicant’s Tariff includes the revised tariff language adopted by the Commission in Order No. 784 regarding third-party ancillary services. Third-Party Provision of Ancillary Services; Accounting and Financial Reporting for New Electric Storage Technologies, Order No. 784, FERC Stats. Regs. at P 200 (2013). 12 See Order No. 697 at P 984 (“We will continue the Commission’s historical practice of granting waiver of Parts 41, 101, and 141 of the Commission’s regulations to certain entities with market-based rate authority”). 13 See id. at P. 999 (“We will continue to grant blanket approval under Part 34 for future issuances of securities and assumptions of liability where the entity seeking market-based rate authority, such as a power marketer or power producer, is not a franchised public utility or does not otherwise provide requirements service at cost-based rates”). 10 • Such other further relief as the Commission may deem appropriate. Applicant will comply with the reporting requirements imposed on entities that are permitted to sell power at market-based rates. In particular, Applicant agrees to make Electric Quarterly Report filings concerning its sales in conformance with the Commission’s requirements 14 and to comply with any other applicable reporting requirements. Because Applicant is a Category 1 Seller in all regions it is not required to submit triennial updated market power analyses. Additionally, pursuant to the requirements of Order No. 652 and 18 C.F.R. § 35.42, Applicant agrees to file timely
notices of material changes in status that explain whether such changes reflect a departure from the characteristics relied upon by the Commission in originally granting market-based rate authority.15 VI. EFFECTIVE DATE Applicant respectfully requests an effective date of November 3, 2020, which is sixty days from the date of filing. VII. 14 See Revised Public Utility Filing Requirements, Order No. 2001, FERC Stats. Regs. [Reg. Preambles] 31,127 (2002), order on reh’g Order No. 2001-A, 100 FERC 61,074 (2002), order on reconsideration and clarification, Order No. 2001-B, 100 FERC 61,342 (2002); see also Order No. 2001-C, 101 FERC 61,314 (2002); Order No. 2001-D, 102 FERC 61,334 (2003); Order No. 2001-E, 105 FERC 61,352 (2004). 15 See Reporting Requirements for Changes in Status for Public Utilities with Market-Based Rate Authority, Order No. 652, 110 FERC 61,097 (2005) (“Order No. 652”). See also 18 C.F.R. § 35.42(a). 11 CATEGORY DETERMINATION Applicant is a Category 1 Seller in theNortheast, regions.In Order No. 697, the Commission created a category of sellers – i.e., Category 1 Sellers – that are exempt from the requirement to automatically update the applicable market power analysis. Category 1 Sellers are defined in the Commission’s regulations as: wholesale power marketers and wholesale power producers that own or control 500 MW or less of generation in aggregate per region; that do not own, operate or control transmission facilities other than limited equipment necessary to connect individual generating facilities to the transmission grid (or have been granted waiver of the requirements of Order No. 888, FERC Statutes and Regulations, Regulations Preambles January 1991June 1996 31,036); that are not affiliated with anyone that owns, operates or controls transmission facilities in the same region as the seller's generation assets; that are not affiliated with a franchised public utility in the same region as the seller's generation assets; and that do not raise other vertical market power issues.28
Category 2 Sellers are defined as “any Sellers not in Category 1.”29 Applicant satisfies the criteria for Category 1 Seller status in the Northeast region for the reasons set forth below. A. Limited Generation Ownership Applicant will operate as a power marketer. Neither Applicant or its affiliates own, operate, or control, any physical generation facilities.
28 18 C.F.R. § 35.36(a)(2). 29 18 C.F.R. § 35.36(a)(3). 12 B. Lack of Transmission Facilities Neither Applicant nor its affiliates, own, operate or control, and are not affiliated with any transmission facilities. C. Lack of Affiliation with a Franchised Public Utility Neither Applicant nor its affiliates own or are affiliated with a franchised public utility in any region. D. No Vertical Market Power Issues Neither Applicant nor its affiliates raise any vertical market power issues. Neither Applicant nor its affiliates own or control intrastate natural gas transportation or intrastate natural gas storage. Neither Applicant nor its affiliates are affiliated with sources of coal supplies or the transportation of coal supplies. Applicant and its affiliates also do not own or control any sites for generation capacity development that could be used to create barriers to entry. Thus, Applicant and its affiliates have not erected and will not erect any barriers to market entry in any market. As demonstrated herein, Applicant is a Category 1 Seller in the Northeast. WHEREFORE, for the reasons discussed more fully above, Applicant respectfully requests that the Commission (1) grant it blanket authority to make sales of capacity, energy, and ancillary services at market-based rates, (2) grant the waivers, authorizations, and preapprovals requested herein, and (3) determine that it is a Category 1 Seller in all regions.
Respectfully submitted, 13 Eric Brunhammer Eric Brunhammer President 34192 Spring Brook Ave. Lewes, DE 19958 (302) 750-3217 (phone) (302) 691-7279 (facsimile) eric@inova-energy.com
Dated: August18, 2020 12266160
record_data.filing_title: Inova Energy LLC Market Based Rate Filing
